intro: Ruellia tweediei, commonly known as the purple heart plant, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States and parts of Mexico. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular, violet-pink flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are typically dark green and glossy, and it produces small, round, blue-black berries after flowering. Ruellia tweediei is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its vibrant color and ability to thrive in a variety of soil types. It is also valued for its drought tolerance and ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
